programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave is thrilled when he wins an electronic home help device called Barry - finally, his family can boss something around other than him, but it is not long before Barry is overwhelmed by the Spuds' demands. Fighting back, Barry takes over Grimsby Heights and heads off to the sea for some well-earned peace and quiet..

programme.sub-title: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Avengers Reassembled

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat.

programme.desc: Fluffy decides to annoy Mike while he is in the middle of a yoga session with Cindy, causing Mike to overreact..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: A pug wants to woo the neighbour's dog but his plans never seem to work out.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit tries to be romantic, but his idea of what that means proves to be very different to Irma's. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: As Team Tennyson fight to stop Dr. Animo from raiding an animal shelter, Ben faces one villain more than he bargained for - King Koil, now Animo's pethero.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: After Tim Buktu's live stream is mysteriously cut short, Team Tennyson must attempt a rescue mission and break inside the highly confidential Area 55 in order to save him.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. The Spuds visit Betty's sister Aunty Barbara on her farm - put in charge of searching for Aunty Barb's chickens and their eggs, Dave goes on an egg-citing adventure involving magic beans!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave's lazy day of doing nothing is ruined when the town sees an uprising of their pants!.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec spends the day going through the Takeaway's lost property box - she finds some old shaving foam which inspires a sweet technique, and a customer calls for help needing a solution to her dad's pongy problem. Bec also rustles up an ingenious 'Lizard Pencil Pot Sharpener' using just three ingredients, and a skate park gets an arty surprise using paint and wheels..

programme.title: Cornwall and Devon Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Frenchman's Creek - Helford to Frenchman's Creek Loop
programme.desc: As the series draws to a close, the presenter walks the secluded coves along the Helford River in a relaxing three-mile loop from Helford Village to Frenchman's Creek and back. Whilst in the area, Julia goes oyster fishing and tries her hand at stand-up paddle boarding, before finishing with a visit to the Cornish Seal Sanctuary.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Ashley Jensen joins Alan at Manor Farm to talk about the festive edition of Sky mystery series Agatha Raisin. Plus, a look behind the scenes of the Queen's Sandringham estate, while Wayne Perrey has advice for DIY table decorations and Aleesha Hansell brings the fizz in today's Best of British.

programme.title: Extreme E Live
programme.desc: The Jurassic X Prix. Coverage of the fifth and final round of the inaugural campaign, held in Bovington, Dorset. Rosberg X Racing's Molly Taylor and Johan Kristoffersson lead the championship after extending their lead at the top of the standings with victory last time out at the Island X Prix in Sardinia.

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro.

programme.title: The Pet Show
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary and Joanna Page celebrate the UK's love of animals, with Loose Women's Nadia Sawalha and her dog tackling the agility course in Ready, Pet, Go. Vet James Greenwood and behaviourist Chirag Patel are also on hand to solve viewers' pet problems, and the winner of the Pet of the Year award is announced.

programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune
programme.sub-title: Sitting on a Fortune Celebrity Christmas
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts a festive edition of the quiz, with Chris Kamara, Sam Quek, Joe Pasquale, Nina Wadia, Colson Smith and the Rev Kate Bottley competing to try to win £100,000 for charity. Correct answers keep the celebrities in the money chair, but a wrong response means they move to the back of the line and risk leaving with nothing. With lots of festive cheer but tensions running high, who has what it takes to hold on to the top spot and play for that massive prize?.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the event from the Royal Albert Hall, with music from Ed Sheeran, Rod Stewart, Anne-Marie, James Blunt, Years & Years, Gregory Porter and Elvis Costello, along with The Greatest Showman's Keala Settle. There is comedy from Judi Love, Bill Bailey, Chris McCausland and Josh Widdicombe, and performances by the casts of hit musicals Moulin Rouge and Matilda.

programme.title: Michael Bublé's Christmas in the City
programme.desc: The Canadian singer celebrates the 10th anniversary of his chart-topping album Christmas with a festive special featuring a mix of comedy, music, special guests and, of course, the spirit of the season.

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams returns with more TV disasters featuring the world's most famous faces. Joanna Lumley nearly falls off a ship, the Good Morning Britain Studio is invaded by ants, and Katy Perry is interrupted by a fire alarm. Plus, there are TV nightmares for the cast and crew of Love Island, Coronation Street, Catchphrase, and I'm A Celebrity.

programme.title: Strictly the Real Full Monty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley Banjo and his team of celebrities try to put cancer awareness back in the spotlight by pulling off an all-singing, all-dancing spectacular in the world's biggest ballroom in Blackpool. But after months of training, tantrums and tears, will all the handwork pay off or has Ashley finally bitten off more then he can chew? The cast grows in numbers with celebrity additions including Coleen Nolen and Ola Jordan, but the scale of the performance soon has the group doubting themselves as the dress rehearsal proves to be a disaster, and two of the cast must sit out injured. Will the big night turn out to be a Strictly success?.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Croft, featuring round 13 of the Mini Challenge UK and round 17 of the Ginetta GT4 Supercup.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts the supermarket-based game show, inviting three pairs of shoppers to 'go wild in the aisles' as they compete in the ultimate supermarket challenge to win a £3,000 prize. New quiz rounds feature alongside the legendary trolley dashes and the most famous pastel jumpers on television.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Sheffield as he hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game..

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At a Christmas family get-together, a cracker riddle states two people will die before midnight on Boxing Day, and just a few hours later family matriarch Lydia meets an untimely end - giving Barnaby the perfect reason to escape a boring Christmas with his in-laws. John Nettles and John Hopkins star, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Margery Mason.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: The Grinch (2018)
programme.desc: In the magical town of Whoville, a race of human-like creatures called Whos are thrilled about celebrating Christmas. However, a cantankerous, furry green loner named the Grinch, who lives in a cave north of Whoville, hatches a dastardly scheme to ruin the festive season. Animated Dr Seuss adaptation, with the voices of Benedict Cumberbatch, Pharrell Williams and Rashida Jones.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill presents clips of seasonal slip-ups and festive fiascos, including a postman being attacked by a turkey, a toddler asking Santa for a beer and a runaway car wrecking a grotto.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Rhidian, Beverley, Whitney and Marvin pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is a shock arrival for Dawn. Priya is crushed. Pollard offers to hire Noah permanently.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: As Emma prepares for her wedding, Amy blows the whistle on Curtis. Kevin dreads Abi learning that Kelly is their new neighbour. Max awaits a decision on his future at school.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Family Adventure
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo continues his quest to explore the roots of his passion for food, taking his in-laws Elizabeth and Malcolm De Friend to explore the beautiful Cilento coast and discover the locals' secret to a long and healthy life.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kelly resolves to move away from the street to spare Abi's feelings. News of Max's fate comes through from his school. Lydia swiftly changes the subject when Sarah mentions Adam.

programme.title: The Big Quiz
programme.sub-title: The Big Soap Quiz: Coronation Street vs Emmerdale
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special edition of the quiz show in which teams from ITV's biggest soaps battle it out to find out who knows the most about their show. Jack P Shepherd is the captain of the Corrie team and is joined by Jane Danson and Tanisha Gorey, while Mark Charnock leads the Emmerdale contingent of Sally Dexter and Emile John.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: A series of sketches taken from the recently-unearthed Morecambe & Wise tape that contained footage which had not been seen for 50 years, and was believed to have been lost forever. The newly discovered half-hour show featured a series of gag-packed routines involving stage curtains, ventriloquism and a daring sketch in which Eric eavesdrops on a newly wedded couple in the flat next door. Now, contributors including Jonathan Ross, Ben Miller and Eddie Izzard look back at this rare slice of classic comedy once again.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. Plane spotters visit the airport looking for a rare sight, and someone attempts to kick off a round-the-world trip using someone else's boarding card.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary profile of the Queen's sister, whose life and loves reflected the social and sexual revolution that transformed Britain during the 20th century. With archive footage and interviews, the series follows Margaret's life as she redefined the image of the modern princess, and begins with her birth in 1930. The abdication of her uncle propelled Margaret to second in line to the throne, but her life would be shaped by dramatic social change as Britain entered a more egalitarian era after the Second World War.

programme.title: Railway Murders
programme.desc: In May 1957 an elderly Polish Countess was travelling home from a party when she was attacked at Gloucester Road Tube station.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: After visiting an original Mosquito at the de Havilland aircraft museum, Airfix designer Paramjit attempts to shrink the wooden wonder to 1:72 scale.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Co Meath town of Enfield to the east coast port of Drogheda in Co Louth. He explores the railway network within the Bog of Allen, learns about the Victorian secrets of the Boyne Viaduct, and ventures into underground zinc mines.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Victorians' fascination with antiquity as he continues his tour of the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland. He visits the cromlech stones of Dundalk, Co Louth, and an observatory in Co Armagh, and travels on the steam railway in Downpatrick, Co Down.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey up the west coast of Scotland and discovers how trains helped spread the reputation of Oban whisky. He also learns about the efforts to build a railway through the desolate Rannoch Moor and visits Corrour, a favourite shooting estate of the political elite in Victorian times.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Ayr to Skye and investigates the parallel 'roads' etched in the side of Glen Roy - one of the geological mysteries of the 19th century. He also finds out how the Victorians put a weather observatory on the top of Ben Nevis, and crosses the Glenfinnan viaduct by steam train.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the final leg of his journey from Ayr to Skye, Michael Portillo discovers how the railways provided Second World War commandos with the means to travel to the isolated landscape of Lochailort, where they were able to train without attracting the attention of German spies. He also learns why langoustines have replaced herring as the best catch in the fishing port of Mallaig, and explores the history of Highland crofters.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns more about the country's railways, beginning with the Great Eastern Line, which runs along the edge of England and into central London. On his travels, the former politician discovers the grave-robbing history of Great Yarmouth and tries his hand at working a Victorian swing bridge in Reedham, Norfolk. He also takes to the air to reveal how a rail guidebook helped aviators during the Second World War.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey along the Great Eastern Line, which ventures from the edge of England to the heart of London. In this leg, he examines the Victorians' fascination with the Suffolk village of Dunwich, Britain's answer to Atlantis, and discovers how nearby Felixstowe became home to the UK's biggest container port.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the sites of Victorian freak shows, rides one of the world's first electric railways in Southend and encounters the preserved head of a medieval politician as he continues his journey along the route of the Great Eastern Line.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Epping, Essex, to Hackney in north-east London, discovering why dairy herds were transported by train all over Britain. He also finds out the importance of the gunpowder trade to Waltham Cross, and learns the gruesome details of the first murder to take place on a train.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to follow the route of the Great Eastern Line, enjoying a ride on a miniature railway hidden beneath London. During his trip, he also rings the bells of Bow Church, and tries his hand at announcing at Fenchurch Street station.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo retraces railway journeys made by Queen Victoria in the south of England, where she would travel from Windsor Castle in Berkshire to her summer retreat on the Isle of Wight. The first leg of the trip takes him from Windsor's railway station to Didcot in Oxfordshire, stopping along the way to view a structure designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in Maidenhead. He also tries to collect the mail in the manner of Victorian postal workers on a steam-powered travelling post office.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour takes him to Alton, Hampshire, where he samples Victorian super food, explores Whitchurch Silk Mill, which has remained untouched for more than 150 years, and drives a steam train on the challenging Watercress Line.

programme.title: Dame Shirley Bassey - A Celebration

Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: The chef concludes his tour with trips to the Languedoc and Provence. In the border town of Uzes, Rick samples salt cod and marvels at a colourful array of French patisserie - selecting a seasonal fig tart to have with his morning coffee. He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin.

However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond compete in a land race from Resolute, Canada, to the North Pole in their most ambitious challenge to date. Pitting horse power against dog power they travel 450 miles across mountainous land masses and jagged sea ice at temperatures as low as minus 65C.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than £1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team head to remotest Kyrgyzstan in search of snow leopards - if the team can find evidence of the endangered big cat, they could protect the region.

programme.title: Eddie Eats Christmas
programme.desc: Eddie Hall takes on eating challenges featuring traditional Christmas foods from a variety of communities, beginning with a gargantuan Caribbean Christmas Combo.

programme.title: Eddie Eats Christmas

programme.title: QI XL

As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy pop out on a last-minute Christmas Eve mission, leaving their youngsters in the apparently capable hands of Geoffrey - cutting more of a strict and stuffy Victorian gent than usual - and wife Wendy. Alas, things don't quite go to plan for the outward-bound duo, as a theft and unexpected trip into deep countryside await. Not only that, but there are encounters with an aggressive bull in a field and a terrifying truck driver to endure. Meanwhile, back at home, Lee's lovably feckless father Frank turns up to offer gifts - in his own inimitable way. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Bobby Ball star.

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: Kurtan receives some sad news about a relative and endeavours to make some new memories. Meanwhile, Kerry discovers a passion for reading and joins the vicar's book club, which goes well until another village resident joins. Spoof documentary, starring Daisy May and Charlie Cooper.

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: Kerry and Kurtan visit the local train station to welcome Reverend Seaton home from a trip to Bristol. In the vicar's absence, the cousins have been handling lots of village administration for him, with Kerry mucking in by looking after the parish chickens and Kurtan manning the phone as the point of contact in case of emergencies. Bafta-winning spoof documentary exploring modern life in a Cotswold village, written by and starring siblings Daisy May and Charlie Cooper, with Paul Chahidi.

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: The annual harvest festival brings the whole village together, but one resident's announcement causes unexpected emotional consequences for the community. Spoof documentary exploring modern life in the Cotswolds, written by and starring siblings Daisy May and Charlie Cooper.

programme.sub-title: Katherine Ryan, Henning Wehn and James Acaster
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to her own brand of humour and introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Henning Wehn and James Acaster.

programme.title: Famalam
programme.desc: Highlights from the comedy sketch show, including an overprotective boyfriend meeting his match, and Scribbler P giving an important lesson on military history. Plus, the competitive aunties cause havoc, Midsomer receives an injection of diversity as Detective Mountree solves a whodunit in a stately home and Fantastic Egusi Films give their inimitable rendition of a Hollywood blockbuster. Starring Vivienne Acheampong, Gbemisola Ikumelo, Samson Kayo, John Macmillan, Tom Moutchi and Akemnji Ndifornyen.

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: Family loyalty is vital in rural communities and Kerry's life-long ambition has been to work with her father, Martin. She is overjoyed when he asks her to help him store some wares in a lock-up garage. Meanwhile, a job at the local bowls club gives Kurtan a new sense of purpose.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Spider-Man 3 (2007)

Meanwhile, he also has to contend with the challenge of his best friend following in his father's villainous footsteps - and a jealous rival developing superpowers of his own. programme.title: Top Gear

programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall

programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event which comes from the Cauberg, a hill in the southern town of Valkenburg, Holland.

programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the ninth series of the comedy panel show. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Top Gear Best of British

programme.title: QI

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Offbeat tourism show in which Richard Ayoade is joined by celebrity guests to enjoy the most efficient weekend break possible. He begins in Barcelona with comedienne and actress Kathy Burke, experiencing the best of this popular holiday destination in just 48 hours. The pair sample adventurous cuisine, including potatoes coated in edible clay, and a cava tasting session quickly descends into disarray. Other highlights include a visit to the Barcelona Football Club museum, a guided tricycle tour, and a trip to see the surrealist work of Catalan artist Joan Miro.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by fellow comedian Adam Hills on a whirlwind weekend in Turkey's largest city. He wants to show The Last Leg host how to holiday with ruthless efficiency, as they cross the River Bosphorus from Europe to Asia, comparing a private yacht tour with the low-price public ferry. The pair have an authentic Turkish shave at a local barbershop that turns out to be a lot closer than they were expecting, and share an awkward moment at a local bath and massage parlour. There's also a visit to the Grand Bazaar market, where both men have a go at haggling.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell return for another episode of previously unseen material from the hit comedy panel show. Among the participants setting out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves are Clare Balding, Liz Bonnin, Jo Brand, Asim Chaudhry, Victoria Coren Mitchell, Greg Davies, Simon Day, Greg James, Guz Khan, Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Stephen Merchant, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Angela Scanlon, John Simm, Ranj Singh, Henning Wehn, Claudia Winkleman and Lucy Worsley.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Joe Lycett, Joe Swash and Ruth Madeley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for this festive edition of the comedy game show. Did one of the panellists really program a satnav so their mother's trip to Lakeside ended up in the Lake District? And would one of the captains really hold up a train to get his daughter's cuddly toy back? Or were they just festive fibs? Rob Brydon hosts the fun.

programme.title: QI XL

Starring Johnny Depp, Al Pacino, Michael Madsen, Anne Heche and Bruno Kirby.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Home for Christmas
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King create a series of festive recipes and chat to guests including the Rev Kate Bottley and Jon Culshaw to find out how they spend Christmas.

programme.title: Jamie's Best Ever Christmas
programme.desc: Two-part special brought to life with animation, in which Jamie Oliver presents his favourite festive recipes. In the first edition, the chef focuses on Christmas Day food, demonstrating how to prepare a traditional turkey dinner with roast potatoes, gravy and vegetables. He also offers tips on making desserts including chocolate truffles and mince pies, as well as mulled wine.

programme.title: Jamie's Christmas with Bells On
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives budding cooks a hand by demonstrating a selection of traditional dishes and fun party food for the festive season. In the first of two programmes, he focuses on preparation, revealing how a little planning before the big day can avoid common disasters, such as turkeys that are still frozen and exploding Christmas puddings. He also introduces a few new ideas, including jerk ham hock and hot rummy lemonade.

programme.title: Jamie's Ultimate Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver has been cooking and experimenting with classic Christmas food for over two decades and this programme pulls together his knowledge and experience to bring the very best of the season. He begins with what he calls the three foundations of Christmas, with guests will forgiving any mistakes as long as the turkey is succulent, the gravy is tasty, and the roast potatoes are perfect, and serves the main course with Brussels sprouts done with chorizo and chestnuts, and glazed carrots. Jamie also shares some other dishes, including gravadlax steeped in a beetroot, horseradish and vodka marinade, as well as gooey chocolate pots, turkey risotto, cocktails, and a classic beef Wellington.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: River Cottage: Three Go Mad at Christmas
programme.desc: It's Christmas at River Cottage and Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is throwing open his doors to some celebrity friends - comedy stars Kathy Burke, Stephen Mangan and Mark Heap. Hugh takes Kathy out on a fishing trip to catch an alternative Christmas Day main course - perfect for non-meat eaters like her, or anyone fancying a change from turkey. Resident forager John Wright heads to the woods in search of wild mushrooms and oak moss for a seasonal starter, and chefs Tim Maddams and Gill Meller demonstrate how to prepare cocktails, breads and trays of vegetables.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: It's Christmas and Hugh's plan is to shoot, harvest, gather and cook enough food to furnish the tables for a magnificent medieval festive banquet..

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall challenges his two chefs to create a new recipe using Brussels sprouts, and a butcher shows how to find the most tender cuts in the forequarter of a cow. The cook also goes hunting for sika deer, to be used in a venison roast, and creates a flaming jam roly-poly using the fat from a cow's kidney.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: River Cottage welcomes the festive season with a Christmas Fayre as Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team share their secrets on how to enjoy the perfect Christmas holiday..

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: In a festive-themed five-part show, Jamie Oliver shares his secrets for achieving a stress-free family Christmas, providing viewers with fool-proof recipes, tips on getting ready for the big meal, and advice on making good use of all the leftover food once December 25 has passed. In the first programme, Jamie demonstrates how to prepare the perfect turkey.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: With his tips on serving up the turkey out of the way, Jamie Oliver turns his attention to brunches, lunches and snacks to stave off hunger during the festive season. He prepares roasted squash and seared beef carpaccio salad, and is joined by his daughters Poppy and Daisy to make American-style pancakes.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: Gennaro Contaldo joins the chef to show how to make the most of Christmas vegetables, focusing on roasted spuds, parsnips and carrots. programme.title: Buddy Vs. Christmas
programme.desc: Buddy goes up against glassblower Deborah Czeresko to make light-filled creations. Buddy's piece depicts an amusing Christmas Eve accident.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornish Christmas
programme.desc: The chef, restaurateur and TV presenter enjoys the festive season in his adopted county. He experiences the tradition of wassailing, goes ice skating at the Eden Project, and joins Port Isaac shanty singers Fisherman's Friends. Using local ingredients, he also prepares a banquet for all his acquaintances, accompanied by local music and drinks.

programme.title: Jamie's Italian Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver draws inspiration from the snowy Alps of north Italy to help create his most delicious Christmas Day yet. In a cosy log cabin, accompanied by his mentor Gennaro Contaldo, the host cooks up an epic meal for the big day, taking turkey and trimmings and giving it extra sparkle with an Italian twist.

programme.title: Jamie's Affordable Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses Christmas ingredients to make a zesty Asian-style warm turkey salad for Boxing Day, plus a turkey and leek pie.

programme.title: Jamie's Best Ever Christmas
programme.desc: Concluding part of the festive culinary programme, which blends live action with animation. Jamie Oliver prepares a selection of his favourite festive food, including his grandmother's recipe for Boxing Day brunch, and Caribbean-inspired jerk ham, as well as pancakes, strudels, Asian salads, clementine jelly and refreshing party drinks.

programme.title: Jamie's Christmas with Bells On
programme.desc: Part two of two. Having taken care of the preparation in the first show, Jamie Oliver now brings everything together for the perfect Christmas Day feast, putting a new twist on Brussels sprouts, making tacos and other snacks, and even spicing up the wine. Finally, he demonstrates how to make the best of leftovers with his Boxing Day turkey chowder.

programme.title: Jamie's Cracking Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver whips up a selection of festive, easily prepared dishes in his own kitchen, showing viewers how to impress friends and family with a menu full of delicious treats. Recipes for some of the chef's personal favourites, including beef Wellington, roast goose with all the trimmings, cocktails, steamed goose buns, and chocolate and marmalade panettone bread-and-butter tart, are certain to help keen cooks raise their Christmas spread to the next level.

programme.title: Donal's Irish Feast
programme.desc: Donal Skehan cooks up a different feast each week using local produce. Here the chef gets festive as he visits a turkey farm and a bakery selling mince pies.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The chef puts his own spin on a variety of festive fare, giving a twist to the traditional roast by steaming a turkey breast filled with sage and onion stuffing and then covering it in a crumble topping made from pistachios and dried cranberries. He gives advice on how to liven up vegetables by cooking glazed carrots with star anise and sprout tops with chestnuts, and makes a spiced orange cake with plum sauce as an alternative to Christmas pudding.

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Chocolate Special
programme.desc: Rachel Khoo explores the world of chocolate with the most delicious festive sweets, bakes and desserts. She shares her stylish and easy recipes for the best yuletide treats.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by Christopher Biggins, Martine McCutcheon and Brian Turner for this Christmas special. On the menu are festive bubble patties, Thai turkey and coconut broth with chilli, coconut and coriander scones, and chocolate bread and butter pudding with spiced cherries. Plus, drinks expert Olly Smith is on hand to knock up some festive tipples, including an alcoholic chocolate milkshake.

programme.title: Gok Wan's Easy Asian Christmas
programme.desc: Gok shares his best recipes for a fabulous Christmas Day feast. Dishes include indulgent French toast with an Asian twist, and belly pork with honey and soy sauce.

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: Culinary queen Rachel Allen's step by step guide on how to conquer the kitchen this Christmas, creating beautifully decadent dishes that take no time at all to make..

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Cake Diaries
programme.desc: The chef shows that the festive season is an ideal time to make baked treats and demonstrates her favourite festive recipes, including a clementine Cake, mincemeat muffins and a Christmas cake with rich fruit sponge.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: Alternatives to traditional Christmas desserts are on the menu as the chef is joined by his mum Sally in the kitchen to make a chocolate mousse. Jamie also shares his recipe for a winter pudding bombe using panatone, ice-cream, crystalised fruit and sherry, uses leftover Christmas pudding to create a festive strudel, and prepares a clementine jelly with help from his nephews.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver offers stress-free tips on how to prepare food in advance or snacks that guests can make themselves during a party, including chicken liver parfait, a cheese fondue and squash soup served in a hollow pumpkin. He also demonstrates how to make pomegranate shots and mulled cider.

The food lovers rustle up classic Christmas pudding, mince pies and chestnut soup, before ending their journey with a feast at the world's largest tree house.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off: Christmas Special
programme.desc: Food writer Mary Berry and baker Paul Hollywood demonstrate how to make a number of festive favourites, including mince pies, Christmas pudding and a traditional yuletide cake. The Great British Bake Off judges also reveal recipes for some tasty new treats for the holiday season.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Christmas Masterclass
programme.desc: Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood demonstrate how to make a number of festive treats, including stollen, mincemeat streusel and a gingerbread house that can be created with all the family. There are also recipes for black bun, which is a Scottish fruitcake traditionally eaten at New Year, and Paul's hand-raised Boxing Day pie that uses all the leftovers from Christmas dinner.

programme.title: Gok Wan's Easy Asian Christmas
programme.desc: Gok shares his best recipes for a fabulous Christmas Day feast. Dishes include indulgent French toast with an Asian twist, and belly pork with honey and soy sauce.

programme.title: Jamie's Night Before Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver returns to help the viewers raise their seasonal game with foolproof recipes and clever last-minute ways to improve their festive dishes. Having surveyed thousands of Brits to find out what ingredients they have bought, what is on their menus and what they already have in their cupboards, Jamie looks at what people fear most about cooking on Christmas Day - from getting the timings right to soggy roast potatoes or a dry turkey - and presents tips to make Christmas dinner classics taste better than ever.

programme.title: Mary Berry's Country House at Christmas
programme.desc: Mary Berry visits Harewood House in West Yorkshire as staff prepare the house for the Christmas festivities, and discovers how country houses like this celebrate the season on a grand scale. She also meets some of the volunteers that are the life and soul of the country house, and hears their stories as they bake traditional gingerbread together. Later, she heads out into Harewood's spectacular grounds and gathers winter foliage for her own seasonal decorations before attending a glittering party for the staff and volunteers, who gather together to preview the house's astounding decorations.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly prepares a festive buffet and edible gifts for three generations of her family, with dishes including pastrami meatballs, brussels sprouts latkes and marzipan treats.

programme.desc: Molly and Nick are celebrating Christmas Eve with Chinese food. Molly's festive menu includes juicy pork soup dumplings and kung pao chicken.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A body is found in an ANC drinking den and Gene quickly decides a girl is guilty of the murder. However, the group's leader complicates matters by confessing to the crime to stop the suspect being deported, pitching the team into a world of illegal immigration and terrorism. Jim's report is nearly finished, but he continues to push Alex to find out what really happened to Sam Tyler.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: With the team's attention focused on investigating a diamond robbery and the murder of three gang members, Alex slips away, vowing to learn the truth about Gene Hunt. When the DCI realises what she is up to, he sets off in pursuit, knowing her discoveries will destroy his world. Final episode of the fantasy crime drama, starring Philip Glenister, Keeley Hawes, Dean Andrews and Marshall Lancaster.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey rings a local radio station with advice for a grieving widow and ends up becoming the airwaves' latest agony aunt _ but can she pluck up the courage to admit she'll only be a 'widow' herself for as long as Her Majesty pleases? Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.desc: Deakin and Boulton follow different leads and set up a TV appeal when a baby is snatched in Sun Hill.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Amy is battling morning sickness, so the last thing she needs is to be caught in the middle of Raf and Harry's ongoing clash of egos. Guy realises that having Harry around isn't doing her any good and offers to transfer the junior doctor - but she realises she has to deal with him in her own way. Mo is basking in her celebrity status while dismissing her sister's career aspirations, although she is forced to rethink things when a star-struck patient turns violent. Jesse helps Zosia when she is told she must improve her bedside manner, only for their friendly flirting to turn into something else.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: With Adam at Lucas's nativity play, Jordan seizes his chance to treat the victims of a bus crash, but his renewed confidence cannot hide the after-effects of his illness. The emotion of Alistair's funeral proves too much for Polly, who snaps at his friend Abe, while Zoe sets Yuki a challenge - to ask May out on a date. Joe McGann and former EastEnders actress Melanie Clark Pullen guest star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A local boy goes missing, and Burnside is forced to turn to a convicted paedophile for help in finding him.

programme.desc: Peggy visits the consultant for tests. It's Simon's first day back at the stall. DCI Mason asks questions about Saskia. Bianca hears about the christening party.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Matthew's afraid to talk to the Police. Jeff enlists Dot's help. Peggy plans the christening. Louise returns to the Square and instantly argues with Bianca.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tragedy looms as Andrew is swept away while trying to save an injured man from a fast-flowing river, giving Sam the opportunity to become the hero of the hour. Meanwhile, Joanna faces up to the traumatic prospect of breaking devastating news to a teenage girl. Gary Mavers and Joseph Millson star.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried investigates when an outbreak of dog poisoning sweeps through the district, while Tristan joins the local bellringers for a farewell drink. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The death of Sharon and Tracey's Aunt Sylvie soon has them jetting off to Hollywood in search of their real father. Festive special of the comedy from 1993, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson, with guest appearances by George Hamilton, George Wendt and Richard Branson.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour plans to put the magic back into Christmas - but ends up with Compo stuck on the roof. Festive instalment of the rural comedy from 1986, starring Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Investigative reporter Maddy Magellan enlists the help of Jonathan Creek, who works as a creative consultant to a stage magician, in a bid to discover who is responsible for a painter's death. First episode of the mystery series, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin, Anthony Head, Sheila Gish and Colin Baker.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The ex-coppers find themselves under the microscope when a psychologist arrives to conduct a study into older men in the workplace - but she soon reveals a more personal reason for her visit. It turns out that five years ago her brother, a cycle courier, was the victim of a hit-and-run that left him unable to recall anything prior to the incident. Now he says he was targeted for the parcel he was carrying, which was stolen at the scene - or so he believes. Sally Phillips guest stars.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Joy is left reeling by the discovery that Stella is her daughter, but rather than try to make up for lost time she attempts to have the inmate transferred to another prison. Meanwhile, Pat hatches a plan to get rid of Natalie forever after she discovers that she used children to get drugs into the prison. Lou experiences a change of heart, asking Rowan Dunlop out on a date, and Donny and Janine take the opportunity to get a little closer.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sun Hill has a bomb scare when a device is discovered in the park. Jeff Stewart stars.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The parents of a teenage murder victim ask Kavanagh to pursue a private prosecution on their behalf and he promptly agrees, despite the fact they are unemployed and unable to pay a fee. The accused is related to a powerful local crook, and finding witnesses prepared to testify proves no easy task. John Thaw stars, with Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.desc: Billy invites a special guest round for tea, whom his mother completely fails to recognise. Guest starring Paul and Linda McCartney.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac prepares to face Jonny in court, determined to win custody of Emma, but her carefully laid plans are thrown into disarray by Paula, who, even at death's door, proves she has the power to tie her daughter in knots. With his divorce finalised and living at home with his mum, Sacha is sure his day couldn't get any worse, but when news of the Nazi war criminal he treated is leaked to the press, he puts his own feelings aside to go to Estelle's aid.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The trainees are hailed as heroes and May finally feels like a doctor after saving the victims of a car accident, but one loose comment could well cost her the support of her friends. Noel is distraught when his father appears not to recognise him during a festive visit to his old people's home, and his concern mounts when several residents show symptoms of serious illness. Adam loses his cool when a jealous Sean goes too far with Jessica, while Ruth faces up to her loneliness after sending Jonathan away and finally lets her guard down with Jay. Ram John Holder (Desmond's) guest stars as Noel's dad, alongside comedian Sean Hughes.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rawton goes undercover as a lonely heart to trace a killer preying on vulnerable women.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy makes a tough decision. Baby Liam's Christening makes him the centre of attention. An overheard conversation has dramatic results for Simon.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Louise and Gianni rescue Simon from the burning flat, while Frank is concerned about Peggy.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam tries to help an overweight local woman whose efforts to slim are placing her life in jeopardy, but only ends up making matters worse, while one of Joanna's patients sparks off yet another major health scare in Cardale. Rural medical drama, starring Joseph Millson and Haydn Gwynne.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James must break the sad news that a dog owner's beloved pet is blind, and Tristan is given an ultimatum by Siegfried. Christopher Timothy, Peter Davison and Robert Hardy star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey find their glamorous new jobs in a casino have a hidden downside, while Dorien rekindles an old flame.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.sub-title: Keeping Up Appearances Xmas 1991: The Father Christmas Suit
programme.desc: Hyacinth makes Richard dress as Father Christmas to hand out presents to the old folk at the church hall. Unfortunately, he visits Emmet on the way and they get drunk, leaving Elizabeth to don the costume and take his place - without Mrs Bucket noticing the switch. Festive special from 1991, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Social climber Hyacinth finds herself all at sea when she makes an unexpected discovery during a QE2 cruise that threatens to jeopardise her dream trip. Christmas special from 1993, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Festive special from 1978. Foggy films a video message to send to Nora's ailing brother in Australia, so he can be reminded what a traditional British Christmas is like. Brian Wilde and Kathy Staff star.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A veteran comedian is found dead in a sealed fallout shelter. Locked from the inside of the concrete bunker with no other means of exit, all clues point to suicide, but Maddy Magellan thinks otherwise and calls on the services of professional illusionist Jonathan Creek.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the mystery of a missing scientist, after the man's wife receives a series of emails from someone claiming to know what happened to him. The physics professor was last seen in 2004, on a train to Paris for a conference, and when he disappeared he was working on a potentially lucrative cold fusion project that had attracted attention from many large organisations. However, as the detectives dig deeper, a shadowy Whitehall figure warns Sandra's boss Strickland they should drop the case.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Phyl and Bev find smuggling alcohol too risky amid the tightened security following Natalie's disappearance, and fall back on blackmailing Rowan Dunlop to preserve their drug supply. Pat feels the pressure of concealing a decomposing body and enlists the help of the two Julies to keep one step ahead of the screws. Elsewhere, Sylvia has a rare chance of romance, until Tina spoils it.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rawton goes undercover as a lonely heart to trace a killer preying on vulnerable women.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Former colleague Julia Piper asks Kavanagh if he will fly out to the States and help her fight the appeal of a convicted murderer on death row. Once in the Land of the Free, he finds himself up against a governor determined to ensure sentence is carried out - and realises that where justice is concerned, the Americans sometimes just do not play cricket. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Lisa Harrow.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian has his poems published, so buys gifts for all the family. Oswald wonders whether he has made the right decision by proposing to Aveline, and Joey discovers he is a father.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Oswald breaks off his engagement to Aveline. Nellie needs some time alone after receiving a worrying letter, and finds solace in a chance encounter with a kindly widower.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rawton goes undercover as a lonely heart to trace a killer preying on vulnerable women.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: It's the day of Amy's hearing and although husband Raf is as supportive as ever, he becomes uneasy when he realises her story contradicts Harry's and confronts his untrustworthy colleague about what really happened. Elliot is hiding in the lab, until Mo coaxes him out to help treat a singing fisherman with an embarrassing secret, a case that helps him confront his own worrying medical symptoms, and Colette works out what is going on between Jesse and Zosia, pulling no punches as she warns the anaesthetist to keep away from his friend's daughter.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. Already delayed by patients and the groom's excesses of the night before, Adam and Jessica's wedding is interrupted by a summons to the hospital to treat the victims of a major road accident. Jay's gentle handling of a teenager who has been abused moves Ruth to make a decision about the future of their relationship, and May pleads with Yuki to forgive her deception. However, the real drama of the day is yet to come. Guest starring Patrick Baladi (Mistresses).

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Beech's dodgy past catches up with him when gangster Jimmy Smith calls in a favour. However, Burnside is becoming suspicious of his corrupt colleague. Leslie Grantham and Denise Van Outen guest star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy goes into hospital for her operation, while Terry suspects Irene of being unfaithful. Martin breaks into Phil's car and steals the stereo.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank is worried about Peggy after her operation. Annie suspects Steve and Matthew, who starts to panic. Barry offers to be Natalie's agency partner.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna is presented with an unenviable dilemma by old flame Martin Henderson, who asks her to leave Cardale and start a new life with him. Meanwhile, an elderly lady reluctant to seek help gives Sam cause for concern. Medical drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Christian Burgess and Joseph Millson.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James, Siegfried and Tristan find different ways of dealing with their domestic problems, and Mrs Hall makes a surprise announcement. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracy and Sharon discover they have been mentioned in an Irish relative's will, but when they arrive on the Emerald Isle they are disappointed to find they have inherited a field. Final episode of the comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: In a festive episode first broadcast in 1995, Hyacinth resorts to alternative methods of recruitment when she gets no response to the adverts for a pageant she is directing. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1995. The Meldrews' wedding anniversary celebrations turn sour as they learn cousin Ursula has died while watching Noel Edmonds - forcing Victor to defy a witch's grim warning and set out to put her affairs in order.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy head for the seaside to spend Christmas in a caravan, leaving Sid and Wally behind. Festive instalment of the long-running rural comedy from 1982, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A teenager sets out to visit her favourite pop star but never returns. Witnesses claim they saw her going into his house, but he pleads his innocence in her disappearance. Offbeat detective drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Alan Davies.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the killing of notorious biker-gang leader Eddie Chapman when his son's girlfriend brings them new information about his death. She reveals her partner must avenge his father's murder as part of a final initiation into the gang, but believes the wrong man is being targeted. Meanwhile, Sandra is forced to reassess her position at Ucos when a former colleague suggests she is wasting her career. Starring Amanda Redman, with her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Tina's bungled bank raid brings her back to Larkhall after all, where the inmates of G Wing are enthusiastically rehearsing for a Prison Idol talent contest, though their new music teacher - Lou's drug addict sister Vicky - is more interested in the contents of Rowan Dunlop's medicine cabinet. Janine is desperate for more time alone with Donny Kimber, and Pat looks to dispose of the body she's hidden in a tumble dryer in the laundry.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate a case at Smithfield Market when a frozen body is found on a meat truck. The victim is carrying a page of parchment written in Arabic and a counterfeit British passport. A number of suspects emerge, including a dealer in antiquities, a forger, and a surgeon who may have been selling human organs. With Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: In a festive episode first broadcast in 1995, Hyacinth resorts to alternative methods of recruitment when she gets no response to the adverts for a pageant she is directing. Suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge is exiled to Warwick by his fellow judges, who feel he must be disciplined for his indiscretion with a claimant. Meanwhile, Jo hears the case of a PA accused of embezzling millions from his boss, the head of a high-ranking electronics corporation - and the trial grows heated when allegations are made about a government minister taking bribes. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian receives a letter from an 18-year-old fan of his poems and arranges to meet her. Mrs Boswell meets up with Derek again.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Beech's dodgy past catches up with him when gangster Jimmy Smith calls in a favour. However, Burnside is becoming suspicious of his corrupt colleague. Leslie Grantham and Denise Van Outen guest star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Raf is not a happy man. Having discovered that pregnant wife Amy cheated on him with Harry, he demands she takes a paternity test - but she knows that finding out the father's identity potentially spells the end of her marriage. Will she go through with it? Colette's warning has hit a nerve with Jesse, who decides to cool things off with Zosia, although she doesn't do herself any favours when she grows jealous of his friendship with a young patient's mother. Elliot continues to shut himself away in the laboratory, only emerging to diagnose an elderly man who senses all is not well with the professor.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Adam fights to free Jessica and Harry from the overturned car after it breaks through the ice and is submerged in the frozen lake. The wedding celebrations are abandoned as the team hears the news, its members pulling together and leaving no stone unturned in the effort to save mother and baby - on what should have been among the happiest days of their lives. Medical drama, starring Tristan Gemmill, with Siobhan Finneran (Benidorm).

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Daly and Rawton find themselves pulling pints as part of an investigation into a protection racket targeting pubs, giving a whole new meaning to the phrase 'behind bars'. Ray Ashcroft and Libby Davison star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank gives Peggy a honeymoon cruise for her birthday. Tony and Luca fight over Sarah. Tony gets arrested. Barry and Natalie set up a dating agency. Melanie moves in with Ian.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sarah and Tony make up after the incident with Luca. Peggy comes out of hospital. Roy talks to Dr Fonseca about Viagra and Martin burgles Matthew's house.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam receives a surprise visit from an old friend who seems to have gone up in the world since their schooldays together, but the reunion has a tragic outcome, making him question his skills as a doctor. Meanwhile, Andrew and Dawn return from their trip to the States. Medical drama, starring Joseph Millson and Gary Mavers.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.sub-title: The Lord God Made Them All
programme.desc: A 1983 Christmas edition. James returns to Darrowby after being demobbed from the army. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Victoria Wood's Midlife Christmas
programme.desc: A festive special from 2009 that attempts to cram an entire night's Christmas viewing into 60 minutes. Highlights include the Midlife Olympics 2009, popular costume drama Lark Pies to Cranchesterford and the adventures of soap star Bo Beaumont, played by Victoria's long-time collaborator Julie Walters. Others joining in the fun are Delia Smith, Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Reece Shearsmith and Anton Du Beke.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: At an ancient stone circle, Foggy, Norman and Compo meet a man waiting for visitors from outer space. Later, after sunset, Howard and Marina try meeting at the same spot. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, starring. Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: An eminent scientist on the brink of a major breakthrough in cancer research is found impaled on a razor-sharp samurai sword in his locked study. Jonathan and Maddie are called in to find out if this is a case of murder or an extremely elaborate suicide. Guest starring Annette Crosbie, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the murder of a man found in an alleyway seven years previously when he is identified on a website covering unexplained disappearances. The victim is named by a woman whose husband hired him six months before his death, but neither of them had thought anything of it when their employee went missing - and seem to know little about him. Meanwhile, Brian and Gerry are distracted by looming job cuts and fear that Ucos could be downsized. With Robert Daws and Claudie Blakley.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Rowan proposes to Lou, and, while Vicky can see right through his devious plot she is so pleased to have a supply of drugs in the family that she agrees to be her sister's bridesmaid. Janine gets permission to visit her mother's grave and has a wonderful away day with Donny, which tempts them both to do a runner. A photograph of her granddaughter inspires Julie S to battle against her cancer, and Sylvia gets an unexpected career boost.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Convinced that an Arab sheikh's driver is covering for his boss over the murder of a prostitute, he is forced to decide whether to see justice done or yield to the temptation of the bribe and back off in the 'national interest'. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo takes on a distressing case in which a waste incinerator company is accused of deliberately hiding a design fault, with harmful consequences for the community. Meanwhile, the home secretary is accused of accepting a bribe - but the evidence goes missing, enabling him to call for Deed's impeachment. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Aneirin Hughes.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Chris's unexpected weekend leave from prison infuriates Tracey, while his model behaviour arouses wife Sharon's suspicions. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Peter Polycarpou.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The success of a new business venture causes Sharon and Tracey's lives to take a new direction. Meanwhile, Dorien advises a depressed Garth, who's desperate to find out what life's all about. With Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: With the swimming pool enterprise beginning to pick up increased trade, Sharon tries to get Chris to agree to sign over his half of the cafe business so she can sell it on. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon, Tracey and Dorien spend a quiet Saturday evening reminiscing about their first boyfriends - then decide to track down the gentlemen in question. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Marcus finally turns the tables on a humiliated Dorien, while Sharon and Tracey wonder whether they have taken on too much by agreeing to build a gangster's swimming pool inside a week - with no work force available and threats of losing their kneecaps if they go over schedule. Peter Vaughan guest stars.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey have a new sideline in double-glazing, and a new, ruthless saleswoman in Dorien. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.sub-title: The Lord God Made Them All
programme.desc: A 1983 Christmas edition. James returns to Darrowby after being demobbed from the army. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Nearly Knew Pavarotti
programme.desc: Foggy gets the chance to show off his talents as a concert promoter when Wesley almost runs over Billy Ingleton - a man who dreams of performing a piano recital. Christmas special from 1995, guest starring Norman Wisdom, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: And a Dewhurst Up a Fir Tree
programme.desc: Foggy anticipates the festive rush and decides to start his shopping early - but is disappointed that the shops are not selling Christmas cards in high summer. The intrepid pensioner then takes forester Big Eric's offer of buying 100 fir trees, only to find they are infested with insects. Meanwhile, Compo gets de-bagged by Ivy and Nora in Sid's cafe. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star in the 1979 Christmas special.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A famous gothic horror writer is found murdered on Halloween, leading Maddy and Jonathan into a macabre world of pantomime skeletons, reincarnation and severed heads. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with Peter Davison and Pippa Haywood.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Maddy and Jonathan investigate the intriguing case of a businessman with an acute fear of watches and clocks who appears to have defied the laws of nature. Evidence soon emerges suggesting he has a bizarre ability to make time stand still - but it could be just an elaborate hoax. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While trying a man with an emotional age of 13 for murder, Deed causes outrage among his fellow judges by delving into a fraud case involving two solicitors. As they, Sir Ian Rochester and even his ex-father-in-law urge him not to get involved, Deed pushes harder for the truth.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While presiding over a murder trial in which a lawyer is representing himself and his younger siblings, Deed rekindles his affair with the scheming Francesca Rochester, ignoring his pregnant daughter's pleas for help in the process. Blind to what's happening around him, and resisting warnings from Jo, the judge eventually realises his mistress has been deceiving him and must hope he has not left it too late to come to the aid of Charlie and her unborn child. High Court drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge makes dangerous enemies by pressing the police for an inquiry into the death of Rufus Baron and also presides over the trial of the producers of a reality TV show, charged with manslaughter of a contestant. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Ben Caplan.
