programme.desc: A local boy goes missing, and Burnside is forced to turn to a convicted paedophile for help in finding him.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Beech's dodgy past catches up with him when gangster Jimmy Smith calls in a favour. However, Burnside is becoming suspicious of his corrupt colleague. Leslie Grantham and Denise Van Outen guest star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A water shortage means that the maternity home is busier than ever and two old schoolmates are reunited, but Marion shuns Shirley's attempts at renewing their friendship until they are brought together later in an unexpected way. Elsewhere, Barbara makes a revolutionary suggestion to help Sister Mary Cynthia treat the bedsores of her patient Tommy Mills, whose wife Gert may be more in need of care than he is. Fred thinks about taking the next step in his relationship with Violet. Drama, guest starring Una Stubbs and David Ryall.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy decide to invite long-lost school friends from the town for a drink at the pub on Christmas Eve. Festive instalment of the long-running comedy from 1981, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Jonathan seizes the opportunity to get his own back on a reviewer who criticised his show by refusing to reveal how his priceless painting was stolen, turning down a £50,000 reward in the process. A disgruntled Maddie must try and persuade him to let bygones be bygones. Drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with a guest appearance by Bob Monkhouse.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Bob Monkhouse

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Problem at Gallows Gate - Part One
programme.desc: First of a two-part story. Adam Klaus's sister Kitty witnesses a murder in a country cottage in the woods during a night spent badger-watching with Maddy and Jonathan. Crime drama, with Alan Davies, guest starring Amanda Holden.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A youngster refuses to undergo a life-saving transplant operation, much to the dismay of his parents, who try to overrule him by taking the matter to court - even though he meets all the legal requirements to make his own decision. In a separate case, two drug addicts accused of killing a boy for his mobile phone are found not guilty of murder.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Marianne's health deteriorates as Colonel Brandon reveals the full extent of Willoughby's betrayal. Meanwhile, Edward states his intentions to honour his engagement to Lucy Steele, despite being disinherited by his mother as a result. Charity Wakefield and Dominic Cooper star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: Lilo Lil confronts the family when Dad decides to come home. Nellie says goodbye to her new man friend.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Preparations for Aveline's wedding do not run smoothly, especially when Yizzel and his friend are in charge of the wedding cars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Daly and Rawton find themselves pulling pints as part of an investigation into a protection racket targeting pubs, giving a whole new meaning to the phrase 'behind bars'. Ray Ashcroft and Libby Davison star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Raf feels isolated from Amy while also having to work alongside Harry, until a vulnerable patient makes him realise he can't live without his wife. Guy offers Jesse a permanent contract but he is reluctant to accept it, knowing that he won't be quite so popular once the CEO finds out about his relationship with Zosia - and as she grows more obsessive, it becomes increasingly difficult to keep a lid on things. Jonny decides to move back to Scotland with Emma - can Mo convince her best friend to stay at Holby?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An old friend of Lenny's tries to embroil him in a plot to burn down the children's home where they spent their youth. Adam is terrified of Jessica regaining consciousness because he will have to tell her the truth about Harry, Jordan is reappointed as acting clinical lead following the recent traumatic events, Louis returns demanding money from Charlie, and Polly faces the inquiry into Alistair's death. Guest starring Barry Sloane (Hollyoaks).

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Quinnan and Boulton tackle the strange case of a drugged dog and a shady hippy, while Hollis defends the reputation of Sun Hill in a pub quiz. Police drama, starring Andrew Paul, Russell Boulter and Jeff Stewart.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jamie and Martin are in trouble over goods stolen by Martin. Peggy looks at herself in the mirror and breaks down. Jeff and Rosa argue over Nicky. Roy answers an impotence advert.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy and Pat shop for Peggy's wedding dress. Ricky will be Frank's Best Man. Pat warns Barry about Natalie. Alex warns Melanie about Ian. Roy goes in search of Viagra.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar readies itself for Christmas 1960 with a festive bus trip to see the Regent Street lights, while a visit from a BBC film crew promises to make it a festive holiday to remember. However, it's a difficult time for grieving mother Iris, bringing back memories of her long-departed baby daughter. At Nonnatus, things are tense as Sister Monica Joan determines to bring the Christmas spirit early - despite Sister Evangelina's disgust. As the community prepares for a televised carol concert, it becomes apparent that Sister Monica Joan has gone missing. Jenny Agutter and Judy Parfitt star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Problem at Gallows Gate - Part Two

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. programme.title: Bad Girls

Fern Britton and Phillip Schofield guest star as themselves.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes across a famous Picasso etching, a rare REO Flying Cloud hot rod and a man trying to sell two gold-plated pairs of miniature trousers.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In a First World War special, Suggs and Stephen Taylor excavate the site of a huge transit camp at Morn Hill, outside Winchester, home to over two million troops, travelling from all over the Empire to the Western Front. They find an array of artefacts from 100 years ago, including dog-tags from British and American soldiers - one of whom they track all the way to his living relative. Also unearthed are iron heels from hobnail boots, cap badges and steel fixings for epaulettes from the 23rd London Regiment, bayonets from Lee Enfield 303s and many more intriguing artefacts such as a condom tin.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Stephen Taylor and Suggs head to Lincolnshire to dig up the remains of a Boulton Paul Defiant plane, one of the best British interceptor night-time fighter planes, shot down by the Luftwaffe during the Hull Blitz of March 1941.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In Weedon Bec, Northamptonshire, Suggs and Stephen Taylor unearth a wealth of Second World War relics from a hoard of ammunition cans to parts of Sten and Bren guns as they uncover the very secret past of a huge, top-secret, arms supply depot that, unknown to many, played a pivotal role in winning the war.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor head on the trail of an iconic Mark IX Spitfire in Belgium. Joining Belgium's top plane hunters, Stephen sets about uncovering the remains of the Spitfire that was shot down while accompanying RAF bombers attacking Nazi trains just before D Day in 1944. Meanwhile, Suggs sets out to find out more about the fate of the Czech pilot Arnost Mrtvy, and discovers how the Czech pilots joined the RAF and provided a fierce and skilled fighting force against the Nazis.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Suggs and Stephen Taylor investigate the remains of an RAF Fairey Battle bomber plane shot down during the forgotten days after Dunkirk as the remaining British and French forces fought to prevent the Nazis sweeping through France. Stephen and his team look for remaining parts of the plane, while Suggs uncovers what they were doing in France and his detective work in France and Britain leads the pair to uncover the Fairey Battle's fate - at the hands of a French plane piloted by Polish pilots who tragically mistook the British for Germans.

programme.title: Hitler's Secret Tunnels
programme.desc: Seventy years after the end of the Second World War, hundreds of miles of tunnels built by the Nazis may still be protecting Hitler's final secrets. When explorers Mike Scott and Luke Mahoney uncover a hidden Nazi document that reveals a sealed Nazi underworld, they search these unexplored tunnel complexes that might hold the answers.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: Documentary following the quest by a dedicated group of investigators to solve one of the last great mysteries of the Second World War. In 1945, as Allied forces closed in, Japanese troops commanded by the notorious Japanese General Yamashita allegedly buried a fortune in treasure in the Philippines. They start their search on a remote mountain, followingacting on a tip from a local eyewitness.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team must find another way into the mountain when a potential water trap is unearthed while digging at Breach-6. A scan reveals a mysterious cave.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team focuses on a tunnel that could be part of the treasure labyrinth. A lawyer reveals some interesting information about Yamashita's treasure.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: Peter is warned of the deadly risks that come with searching for Yamashita's treasure. After days of frustration, the team get their biggest breakthrough yet.

Shortly after being demobbed from the Women's Royal Army Corps, she discovered she was pregnant, and with no support from her boyfriend, made the decision to give up her baby for adoption. Now, after several health scares, she fears time is running out to find her daughter. Army reservist John Farrell, from Bootle in Merseyside, was a teenager when he learnt the man he had called dad all his life was not in fact his father. Travelling over there, he untangles a tale of rags-to-riches and learns that sure enough, his family were indeed story-tellers - but fascinatingly, they were also said to be vampire-slayers.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Single mother-of-two Tara feels like a prisoner in her own body. Riddled with joint pain, she is determined to lose weight and see her children grow up.

programme.title: My 600lb Life

programme.title: My Extreme Excess Skin
programme.desc: The stories of one woman who narrowly survived weight loss surgery and another whose excess skin is affecting her career.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress

programme.desc: Trisha's father helps her pick out a dress, while Caitlin has her fitting now that her dad is well enough to attend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Crystal seeks a dress designed by Pnina Tornai, while Deborah feels a strong connection with Diana, Princess of Wales, and is determined to have her own royal wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cynthia's veil clashes with her dress, causing mayhem, while Passant is running out of time with a limited selection of outfits.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Second-time bride Becky hunts for a dress to make up for her disastrous first wedding, while Monica prepares to wed - four years after buying her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamara looks for a gown that makes a statement, while Stephanie arrives for her fitting, not yet convinced she has bought the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The salon has a big sale - one of four a year - giving the brides an opportunity to snap up designer dresses at bargain prices.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tall Rebecca is on the hunt for a dress with the wow factor, but is afraid everything will come up too short, while Valerie is a small bride with big dress dreams.

programme.title: Deadliest Mums & Dads

programme.title: My Extreme Excess Skin
programme.desc: A look back at individuals who underwent a combined 33 surgeries removing over 350lbs of surgical skin, featuring never-before-seen moments and dramatic updates.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr. Emma Craythorne and her team of experts are on a mission to solve complex skin conditions. They help people whose lives have been impeded by devastating disorders..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When an innocent woman in a quiet town was shot in broad daylight, detectives immediately acted to find her killer, referencing video surveillance as possible evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a woman in Key West, Florida, that yielded nothing but a pair of sandals which may have belonged to her. Then two important pieces of video surfaced, and police began to wonder if they should be searching for a missing person or a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a mother-of-two and army wife found dead in her bedroom. There were messages left near her body, and a gun in her hand. programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is called in to investigate a double murder after a corrupt local government hinders the police.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a seriously injured dog and surgeons battle to save its life.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri welcomes Mballa, a new cheetah cub from South Africa, to the Australia Zoo family. Robert sets out to save a stranded platypus.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A bride who hates trying on dresses in shops buys 10 gowns online instead - but finds she does not like any of them.

programme.desc: A bride and her sister disagree about the bridesmaids wearing a form-fitting dress, while another battles with her mother about necklines.

programme.desc: A bridesmaid searching for a husband threatens to leave the bridal party is she is not able to show off her body in a short dress.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How technology such as mobile phones, CCTV and cashpoints can help solve murder investigations.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How investigators are devoting time to cracking cartels in a sinister criminal underground spawned by the prevalence of drug trafficking.

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The murder of Elizabeth Begaren, shot dead after her car was run off California's Route 91 in January 1998. The case went cold for 15 years until her husband Nuzzio was convicted of soliciting Los Angeles gang member Guillermo Espinoza to commit the act in order to access the proceeds of an insurance policy.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old nursing student Maura Murray, who went missing in February 2004 minutes after being involved in a traffic collision. For no apparent reason she had driven 144 miles north from her campus and the accident was the second road incident she had suffered within two days.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers reveal a sophisticated burglary with estimated losses of £8million when they investigate why a bank manager is unable to open his vault.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The staff try to find the perfect dress for a woman who is having a tough time seeing herself as a beautiful bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Talia wants the diva look on her wedding day - the only problem is, so does her mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Mom's Not On The Guest List
programme.desc: Kayla wants her family's help to find a dress even though they are not invited to the wedding. Elsewhere, Dori's mother and grandmother want her to wear their family heirloom.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Randy Will Show You The Door
programme.desc: Bridal model Jessica brings her outspoken clique with her to Kleinfeld's, but Randy threatens to kick them out. Meanwhile, Marlo returns with her opinionated twin.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Peter Gunn, a 39-year-old man whose birth mother gave him up for adoption when he was only nine months old, sets out to track down his biological mum. For years, Peter struggled with a sense of rejection as a result of being parted from his natural parents at such an early age, but having overcome his resentments, he now seeks to answer some burning questions about his past. Meanwhile, 71-year-old north Wales resident Ron Williams asks for help in his lifelong quest to track down the estranged younger sister with whom he spent an idyllic childhood - until she was adopted away from the family. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. JT is almost 900lbs with a 100lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.

programme.desc: Series exploring some of the most startling criminal cases of the past two decades where technology has changed the course of the investigations.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A destitute criminal terrorises central Florida, robbing middle aged men, executing them and disposing of their dead bodies in random wooded areas.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A mentally unstable man goes on a two-hour shooting spree, killing one man and wounding two others.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of a middle-class couple's marriage, including the moment that money, ambition and suspicion prompted the wife to snap and kill her husband of 35 years.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Police find threatening e-mails, an abandoned truck and an abundance of evidence at the crime scene - but no body. Series revealing how forensics are used to solve violent crimes.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them, including the discovery of threatening e-mails and the story of an abandoned truck.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A destitute criminal terrorises central Florida, robbing middle aged men, executing them and disposing of their dead bodies in random wooded areas.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A mentally unstable man goes on a two-hour shooting spree, killing one man and wounding two others.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of a middle-class couple's marriage, including the moment that money, ambition and suspicion prompted the wife to snap and kill her husband of 35 years.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Police find threatening e-mails, an abandoned truck and an abundance of evidence at the crime scene - but no body. Series revealing how forensics are used to solve violent crimes.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A woman kills a tenant and a landlord after the landlord offered her free rent to take care of his troublesome tenants.

programme.title: Evidence of Evil
programme.desc: Series exploring some of the most startling criminal cases of the past two decades where technology has changed the course of the investigations.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A destitute criminal terrorises central Florida, robbing middle aged men, executing them and disposing of their dead bodies in random wooded areas.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A mentally unstable man goes on a two-hour shooting spree, killing one man and wounding two others.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of a middle-class couple's marriage, including the moment that money, ambition and suspicion prompted the wife to snap and kill her husband of 35 years.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Police find threatening e-mails, an abandoned truck and an abundance of evidence at the crime scene - but no body. Series revealing how forensics are used to solve violent crimes.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them, including the discovery of threatening e-mails and the story of an abandoned truck.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.

programme.title: Medical Detectives

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Evidence of Evil
programme.desc: Series exploring some of the most startling criminal cases of the past two decades where technology has changed the course of the investigations.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A destitute criminal terrorises central Florida, robbing middle aged men, executing them and disposing of their dead bodies in random wooded areas.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A mentally unstable man goes on a two-hour shooting spree, killing one man and wounding two others.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of a middle-class couple's marriage, including the moment that money, ambition and suspicion prompted the wife to snap and kill her husband of 35 years.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Police find threatening e-mails, an abandoned truck and an abundance of evidence at the crime scene - but no body. Series revealing how forensics are used to solve violent crimes.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them, including the discovery of threatening e-mails and the story of an abandoned truck.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A self-taught serial killer crisscrosses the country at random, targeting victims of opportunity and murdering them with pre-stashed weapons and tools he calls 'kill kits'.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers

programme.sub-title: The Kidnap and Murder of an Heiress

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a woman dies, it initially appears as though she suffered an accidental fall. Through the persistence of family and friends, law enforcement discover a different story.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A street preacher and his teenage protege run an Internet scam to rob unsuspecting men, steal their identities, then dump their dead bodies in the woods.

programme.title: Fatal Vows

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. Police found his residence undisturbed with no evidence of foul play, but his allies refused to give up their search, forcing authorities to consider such theories as murder, a government conspiracy or even alien abduction.

programme.title: Evidence of Evil
programme.desc: Series exploring some of the most startling criminal cases of the past two decades where technology has changed the course of the investigations.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A destitute criminal terrorises central Florida, robbing middle aged men, executing them and disposing of their dead bodies in random wooded areas.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A mentally unstable man goes on a two-hour shooting spree, killing one man and wounding two others.

programme.title: Fatal Vows
programme.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of a middle-class couple's marriage, including the moment that money, ambition and suspicion prompted the wife to snap and kill her husband of 35 years.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The rape and murder of 23-year-old Peyton Tuthill in February 1999. Colorado detectives were frustrated in finding the killer after DNA evidence from a bloodied sweatshirt suggested they had apprehended the wrong man. It later transpired the murderer, Donta Page, had been serving a 20-year prison sentence, but had recently been released so he could attend a drug treatment programme.
